articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron is leaning towards recognising a Palestinian state, but diplomats and experts say such a move may prove a premature and ineffective way to pressure Israel into moving towards a peace deal with the Palestinians.
articles.title: Macron navigates rocky path to recognising Palestinian state

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians voiced wariness on Tuesday toward a U.S.-backed foundation set to bring aid to Gaza amid signs of famine, with Hamas warnings about biometric screening procedures keeping many away from distribution points.
articles.title: Palestinians wary as US-backed aid group begins operations in Gaza

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Russian forces have captured four villages in Ukraine's northeastern Sumy region, the local governor said, the latest battlefield setback for Kyiv as it seeks to hold territory and avoid handing Moscow the advantage in any peace talks.
articles.title: Russia seizes villages in northern Ukraine, drone attacks ease

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: The contacts mark a significant development in ties between the two countries.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syria and Israel in direct talks focused on security, sources say

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: The U.S. will not seek the death penalty for a son of convicted Mexican drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, Joaquin Guzman Lopez, if he is convicted on U.S. drug trafficking charges of his own, prosecutors said in a court filing.
articles.title: El Chapo's son Guzman Lopez would not get death penalty if convicted, US says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's envoy, Keith Kellogg, on Wednesday scolded a top Russian official for stoking fears of World War Three after Trump warned President Vladimir Putin was playing with fire over Ukraine.
articles.title: U.S. scolds Russia for stoking WW3 fears after Trump's 'playing with fire' remark

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran executed a man accused of spying for Israel, according to a report from judiciary news outlet Mizan on Wednesday that identified him as Pedram Madani.
articles.title: Iran executes man accused of spying for Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in St. Vincent and the Grenadines on Tuesday said they found a boat beached on the shore of Canouan island carrying the remains of what they believed to be 11 people who may be from Mali, though investigations into their identities are ongoing.
articles.title: Eleven bodies found in beached boat in Eastern Caribbean

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian air defences destroyed or intercepted well over 100 Ukrainian drones far into the night over widely separated areas of Russia, including a swarm of drones repelled while headed for Moscow, officials said early on Wednesday.
articles.title: Air defences down dozens of Ukrainian missiles in Moscow, widely separated Russian regions

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The move comes as the Trump administration has sought to ramp up deportations and revoke student visas as part of his hardline immigration agenda.
articles.title: Trump administration halts scheduling of new student visa appointments
